reviews.review_msg: Very insightful and makes class interesting. Dale was helpful, approachable, and organized. Class textbooks were longer but actually enjoyable to read and very relevant to course material and there was never an awkward silence in discussions. One the best American history professors at SFU, if you have the chance to take a class with him take it!
Amazing prof. I usually have a hard time committing to 8:30 a.m classes especially if its history but Dale makes the class seem so interesting and makes you not want to miss class.

Amazing teacher! So knowledgeable and so passionate about what he teaches, tells everything like a story and you don't want it to stop. His voice just draws you in. He's a fair marker, he will acknowledge the work you've put in and he gives great feedback. If you miss a class you're screwed though so make sure you attend!

Dale is an incredible lecturer. His voice fills the room so you cant help but be riveted. He is passionate about what he teaches it and treats all of his students like adults and equals. He really gets the class into the subject, and the 3 hour lectures arent long enough. His class was my favourite class and I would recommend it to everyone

As someone who learns best from lectures, I really enjoyed his class.  He has an epic voice that makes you intent on hearing what he has to say next.  His on screen notes aren't incredibly detailed so you have to pay attention to the lecture.

Dale's lectures are very engaging and I think this is his best quality as a professor.  I have a hard time sitting still and paying attention in 3 hour lectures but Dale's lectures just whizz by.  He ties in current events with the subject he's teaching and he seems to care about the quality of information he's providing.

Great prof!  Entertaining lectures and very helpful.  Discussions in tutorial were enjoyable w/ lots of content about current events.  High amount of reading for a 200 level course but you'll want to keep on top of it for tutorial. Mark was based off tutorial, midterm, final, & a 2000 word paper. Reasonably difficult course but he's a fair marker.
Amazing lecturer, powerful discussions about American history throughout the semester. There is a lot to remember.
